items.body_markdown:
I'm writing a custom wordpress plugin and trying to incorporate some functionality from a third-party plugin. That plugin seems to use `add_meta_box` to create the fields for settings options on the plugin admin pages.  I searched the entire source code of the plugin for `add_settings_field` and it doesn't occur once.  Are the two functions basically interchangeable?  From the WP Codex, it seems that add_meta_box is primarily for the purpose of adding "a custom section to the post and page editing screens" -- i.e. not so much intended for the admin settings/options forms.  On the other hand, the 3rd-party plugin seems to work very well, which is why I'm borrowing from it... 

So in short my question is this: can someone please explain correct usage for the `add_meta_box` and `add_settings_field` functions?  Thanks!  Please let me know if anything about this question is unclear and I will do my best to rephrase.
items.title: Writing a wordpress plugin: add_meta_box vs. add_settings_field?
items.body:
I'm writing a custom wordpress plugin and trying to incorporate some functionality from a third-party plugin. That plugin seems to use add_meta_box to create the fields for settings options on the plugin admin pages. I searched the entire source code of the plugin for add_settings_field and it doesn't occur once. Are the two functions basically interchangeable? From the WP Codex, it seems that add_meta_box is primarily for the purpose of adding "a custom section to the post and page editing screens" -- i.e. not so much intended for the admin settings/options forms. On the other hand, the 3rd-party plugin seems to work very well, which is why I'm borrowing from it...

So in short my question is this: can someone please explain correct usage for the add_meta_box and add_settings_field functions? Thanks! Please let me know if anything about this question is unclear and I will do my best to rephrase.

items.title: Convert Java 7 Map Iterator with operation into Java 8
items.body:
I'm trying to convert following Java 7 Map Iteration code to Java 8. Could you please help me to do so. I have tried few ways to do it but stuck to assemble/add data in JSON Object. Please find below code.

for (Map.Entry<String, HashSet<TableDetails>> entryTableToColumn : tableToColumnAndDataTypeMap.entrySet()) {                                

JSONObject tableJson = new JSONObject();
tableJson.put("tableName", tableName);

JSONArray columnJsonArray = new JSONArray();
  JSONArray primaryKeysJsonArray = new JSONArray();
 for (TableDetails entryColumnToDataType : entryTableToColumn.getValue()) {
        JSONObject columnJSON = new JSONObject();
        String columnName = entryColumnToDataType.getColumnName();
        String columnType = entryColumnToDataType.getColumnDataType();
        if (Objects.nonNull(columnName) && Objects.nonNull(columnType)) {
            columnJSON.put("columnName", columnName);
            columnJSON.put("sourceColumnType", columnType);

           //Some Operation on columnJSON

        }
        columnJsonArray.add(columnJSON);

        if (entryColumnToDataType.isPrimaryKey()) {
            JSONObject priJSON = new JSONObject();
            priJSON.put("columnName", entryColumnToDataType.getColumnName());
            priJSON.put("sourceColumnType", entryColumnToDataType.getColumnDataType());
            primaryKeysJsonArray.add(priJSON);
        }
    }

      tableJson.put("columns", columnJsonArray);
    tableJson.put("primaryColumns", primaryKeysJsonArray);
    tableJsonArray.add(tableJson);

}

items.body_markdown:
I have a very tricky question here. I know how to write a rolling months in SQl but the thing now is how can i write rolling less than 13 months. For example : How should i write rolling months for less than 13 months. for example April 1 2018 to march 21 2017. I know how to write rolling months like april 18 to april 17 or march 17. If someone can help me with this that would be great. Thanks!!

    DECLARE @Date DATE
    declare @BeginDate varchar(100)                                                                             
    declare @EndDate varchar(100)
                                                                                                                                    
    SELECT @BeginDate = DATEADD(MONTH, -12, CAST(dateadd(d,-(day(getdate()-1)),getdate()) AS date))                    
    SELECT @EndDate = CAST(dateadd(d,-(day(getdate())),getdate()) AS DATE)
items.title: rolling less than 13 months in sql
items.body:
I have a very tricky question here. I know how to write a rolling months in SQl but the thing now is how can i write rolling less than 13 months. For example : How should i write rolling months for less than 13 months. for example April 1 2018 to march 21 2017. I know how to write rolling months like april 18 to april 17 or march 17. If someone can help me with this that would be great. Thanks!!

DECLARE @Date DATE
declare @BeginDate varchar(100)                                                                             
declare @EndDate varchar(100)

SELECT @BeginDate = DATEADD(MONTH, -12, CAST(dateadd(d,-(day(getdate()-1)),getdate()) AS date))                    
SELECT @EndDate = CAST(dateadd(d,-(day(getdate())),getdate()) AS DATE)

items.title: Caffe: make: *** [.build_release/src/caffe/util/blocking_queue.o] Error 1

CXX src/caffe/util/blocking_queue.cpp
In file included from /usr/local/include/boost/bind/bind.hpp:2187:0,
                 from /usr/local/include/boost/bind.hpp:22,
                 from /usr/local/include/boost/thread/detail/thread.hpp:30,
                 from /usr/local/include/boost/thread/thread_only.hpp:22,
                 from /usr/local/include/boost/thread/thread.hpp:12,
                 from /usr/local/include/boost/thread.hpp:13,
                 from src/caffe/util/blocking_queue.cpp:1:
/usr/local/include/boost/bind/bind_mf_cc.hpp:52:6: error: expected unqualified-id before ‘:>’ token
     >:>type BOOST_BIND(R (BOOST_BIND_MF_CC T::*f) () const BOOST_BIND_MF_NOEXCEPT, A1 a1)
      ^
Makefile:584: recipe for target '.build_release/src/caffe/util/blocking_queue.o' failed
make: *** [.build_release/src/caffe/util/blocking_queue.o] Error 1

Does somebody know how to fix it ? Thank you very much!

items.title: How to return data at the end of all loops in Nodejs
items.body:
I need to return data at the end of all loops included nested loops but somehow last promise.all executing before all the above script to be executed.

Here is the code I've tried but no luck.

    exports.getData = function (autoGroupId, startDate, endDate, givenDate) {

let promises = [];

let lastweekDates = [];

return this.getAutoDealerByAutoGroupID(1).then(function (autoDealers) {
    //Iterate on dealers --- Map = foreach
    let i = 0;
    return autoDealers.map(function (dealer) {
        i++;

        let dealerObj = {
            sales: {
                new: [],
                used: [],
            },
            vehicleModel: {
                new: [],
                used: [],
            }
        };
        autoDealerID = dealer.id;
        dealerObj.dealer = dealer;

        //Iterate on dates
        //Last Week sales 
        lastweekDates.map((saleDate) => {

            salesFilter.saleDate = saleDate;
            salesFilter.autoDealerID = autoDealerID;
            salesFilter.vehicleTypes = ['New'];
            let sumSales = saleRepository.sumSales(salesWhere, salesFilter).then(function (resultSumSales) {
                let resultParseData = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(resultSumSales));
                resultParseData = baseService.makeNullKeysToZero(resultParseData);
                resultParseData[0].sale_date = saleDate;

                dealerObj.sales.new.push(resultParseData[0]);
            });

            salesFilter.vehicleTypes = ['Used'];
            let sumSalesUsed = saleRepository.sumSales(salesWhere, salesFilter).then(function (resultSumSales) {
                let resultParseData = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(resultSumSales));
                resultParseData = baseService.makeNullKeysToZero(resultParseData);
                resultParseData[0].sale_date = saleDate;

                dealerObj.sales.used.push(resultParseData[0]);
            });

            promises.push(sumSales);
            promises.push(sumSalesUsed);
        });

        //Count sales by Model for each dealer
        vehicleModelFilter.autoDealerID = autoDealerID;
        vehicleModelFilter.vehicleTypes = ['New'];
        vehicleRepository.getVehicleModels(vehicleModelWhere, vehicleModelFilter).then(function (vehicles) {
            let resultParseData = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(vehicles));

            resultParseData.map(function (vehicle) {

                let vehicleModelSalesWhere = " AND a.sale_date BETWEEN :dateFrom AND :dateTo AND b.auto_dealer_id = :autoDealerID AND e.vehicle_type IN (:vehicleTypes) AND b.vehicle_model_id = :vehicleModelId";
                let vehicleModelSalesFilter = {
                    dateFrom: startDate,
                    dateTo: endDate,
                    autoDealerID: autoDealerID,
                    vehicleTypes: ['New'],
                    vehicleModelId: vehicle.vehicle_model_id
                };
                let countSalesByModel = saleRepository.countSales(vehicleModelSalesWhere, vehicleModelSalesFilter).then(function (result) {
                    let resultParseDataCnt = JSON.parse(JSON.stringify(result));
                    vehicle.vehicle_model_sales_count = resultParseDataCnt[0].vehicle_model_sales_count;
                    dealerObj.vehicleModel.new.push(vehicle);

                });
                console.log("first");
                promises.push(countSalesByModel);
            });
            return Promise.all(promises).then(function () {

                return dealerObj;
            });

        }).then(function (dealerObj) {
            //Working Days
            let getFilteredWorkingDays = workingDayRepository.getFilteredWorkingDays(workingDaysFilter).then(function (resultGetFilteredWorkingDays) {
                let resultParseData = baseService.parseData(resultGetFilteredWorkingDays);

                if (resultParseData != null) {
                    resultParseData['currentDay'] = baseService.getPassedDayNumber(startDate);
                    dealerObj.workingDays = resultParseData;
                } else {
                    dealerObj.workingDays = {};
                }
            });

            //promises.push(countEachVehicleModelUsed);
            promises.push(getFilteredWorkingDays);
            return Promise.all(promises).then(function (result) {

                console.log("second");
                dealersData.dealers.push(dealerObj);
                //return dealersData;
            });

        });

    });


    //Loop End
    return Promise.all(promises).then(function (result) {

        return dealersData;
    });


});

}

Also, Is this a right way to return such type of complex data ?

Really appreciate your quick and soft responses.

    FIRE
    BERJUMLAH
    9 POKEMON

    POISON
    BERJUMLAH 12 POKEMON

    GHOST
    BERJUMLAH 3 POKEMON

    ELECTRIC
    BERJUMLAH 4 POKEMON

    PSYCHIC
    BERJUMLAH 5 POKEMON

    3
 
    GRASS BERJUMLAH 9 POKEMON
    BUG BERJUMLAH 10 POKEMON
    NORMAL BERJUMLAH 10 POKEMON
    ROCK BERJUMLAH 4 POKEMON
    WATER BERJUMLAH 18 POKEMON

    FLYING
    BERJUMLAH 6 POKEMON

    GROUND
    BERJUMLAH 4 POKEMON

    13
    rows selected.

and this my sql code:

      SELECT    NVL (e.tipe_elemen, NULL)
             || ' BERJUMLAH '
             || t.jumlah_pokemon
             || ' 
            POKEMON'
                AS "POKEMON"
        FROM tamers t,
             elemen e,
             pokemon p,
             catch_pokemon c
       WHERE     p.kode_elemen = e.kode_elemen
             AND t.id_tamers = c.id_tamers
             AND c.nomor_pokemon = p.nomor_pokemon
             AND e.tipe_elemen < TO_CHAR (1)
    ORDER BY tipe_elemen;
items.title: select with dml without join
items.body:
How do I show like this but ignore to using join, just pure of DML:

JUMLAH POKEMON
---------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
FIGHTING
BERJUMLAH 5 POKEMON

FIRE
BERJUMLAH
9 POKEMON

POISON
BERJUMLAH 12 POKEMON

GHOST
BERJUMLAH 3 POKEMON

ELECTRIC
BERJUMLAH 4 POKEMON

PSYCHIC
BERJUMLAH 5 POKEMON

3

GRASS BERJUMLAH 9 POKEMON
BUG BERJUMLAH 10 POKEMON
NORMAL BERJUMLAH 10 POKEMON
ROCK BERJUMLAH 4 POKEMON
WATER BERJUMLAH 18 POKEMON

FLYING
BERJUMLAH 6 POKEMON

GROUND
BERJUMLAH 4 POKEMON

13
rows selected.

and this my sql code:

  SELECT    NVL (e.tipe_elemen, NULL)
         || ' BERJUMLAH '
         || t.jumlah_pokemon
         || ' 
        POKEMON'
            AS "POKEMON"
    FROM tamers t,
         elemen e,
         pokemon p,
         catch_pokemon c
   WHERE     p.kode_elemen = e.kode_elemen
         AND t.id_tamers = c.id_tamers
         AND c.nomor_pokemon = p.nomor_pokemon
         AND e.tipe_elemen < TO_CHAR (1)
ORDER BY tipe_elemen;

items.title: Angular Routing with CLI
items.body:
Angular Routing is not working. It only works when I put in index.html

Is the routing i have done is fine or not? If anyone has example related to angular then please do mail me at saijalshakya1@gmail.com

app.module.ts

import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';   
import { AppComponent } from './app.component';
import { OurteamComponent } from './ourteam/ourteam.component';
import { AppRoutingModule } from './app-routing.module';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent,
    OurteamComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }

app-routing.module.ts

   import { BrowserModule } from '@angular/platform-browser';
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';


import { AppComponent } from './app.component';
import { OurteamComponent } from './ourteam/ourteam.component';
import { AppRoutingModule } from './app-routing.module';

@NgModule({
  declarations: [
    AppComponent,
    OurteamComponent
  ],
  imports: [
    BrowserModule
  ],
  providers: [],
  bootstrap: [AppComponent]
})
export class AppModule { }

app.component.html

<h1>saijal shakya</h1>

<router-outlet></router-outlet>

ourteam.component.html

<p>
  ourteam works!
</p>
<router-outlet></router-outlet>

index.html

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>Sxc</title>
  <base href="/">

  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
  <link rel="icon" type="image/x-icon" href="favicon.ico">
</head>
<body>
</body>
</html>

items.title: Want to add image to my program
items.body:
The class I have show you it had call by another class that class extend JPanel, And this class use for create Rectangle and have property when it collision with another. And I want to know how to add image to the Rectangle. If the graphics2D can't add the image I want to change it to label or something it work. pls guide me

import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;

public class Entity{

private int x;
private int y;
private int size;
private BufferedImage image;

    public Entity(int x){
        this.size = x;
    }

    public int getX() {
        return x;
    }

    public int getY() {
        return y;
    }

    public void setX(int x) {
        this.x = x;
    }

    public void setY(int y) {
        this.y = y;
    }

    public void setPosition(int x, int y){
        this.x = x;
        this.y = y;
    }

    public Rectangle getBound(){
        return new Rectangle(x ,y,size, size);
    }

    public boolean isCollid(Entity e){
        if (e == this) return false;
        return getBound().intersects(e.getBound());
    }

    public void render(Graphics2D g2d){
        g2d.fillRect(x, y, size, size);
    }
}

For dataset having two columns:`id, fn`; I want to set first id value same in all rows untill fn has non-zero value. Once row with fn having non-zero value is found, the next row "id" column will be used to fill in subsequent rows till again row with "fn" column having non-zero value.
And i want this updated "id" to be put in new column, to compare original "id" and new id value from this.

    val s1 = Seq(
         | (1, 0),
         | (1, 0),
         | (2, 0),
         | (2, 0),
         | (3, 4)

         | (7, 0),
         | (7, 8)

New column added at extreme right.

items.body_markdown:
I have inherited a Google Cloud Platform account which contains about a dozen projects that were setup years ago for sub-clients. I suspect most of them are not used in any way and can be deleted. I would like to make an inventory of each project to know:

- what things it is using,
- how are the things used, 
- and are the things billable.

Here, I'm using the word *things* to describe that which can be enabled in a GCP project, because I don't know if other terms have specific meanings in GCP, such as *services* or *resources*.

I know these things can include, for example: Compute Engine instances, storage buckets, VPN networks, and API keys. 

On the dashboard for one of the projects, on the *Resources* card, it shows: `App Engine (1 version)` and `Compute Engine (You do not have permission to see this information)`. I'm pretty sure this project doesn't use Compute Engine, only App Engine, so I'm confused by the *You do not have permission* message. I also know this project uses some API keys that for accessing the Google Maps Javascript API, but the Dashboard doesn't show this. The *API Manager* does list API credentials for the project, but it doesn't show what the key is *used for*, or *where* they are in use (if I remember correctly, when you setup a Google Maps API key you must enter the domain names it will be valid for).

Is there one place in GCP to view everything that is used by a project so that I may determine if it is safe to delete it?
items.title: How to see everything used in a Google Cloud Platform project?
items.body:
I have inherited a Google Cloud Platform account which contains about a dozen projects that were setup years ago for sub-clients. I suspect most of them are not used in any way and can be deleted. I would like to make an inventory of each project to know:

  • what things it is using,
  • how are the things used,
  • and are the things billable.

Here, I'm using the word things to describe that which can be enabled in a GCP project, because I don't know if other terms have specific meanings in GCP, such as services or resources.

I know these things can include, for example: Compute Engine instances, storage buckets, VPN networks, and API keys.

On the dashboard for one of the projects, on the Resources card, it shows: App Engine (1 version) and Compute Engine (You do not have permission to see this information). I'm pretty sure this project doesn't use Compute Engine, only App Engine, so I'm confused by the You do not have permission message. I also know this project uses some API keys that for accessing the Google Maps Javascript API, but the Dashboard doesn't show this. The API Manager does list API credentials for the project, but it doesn't show what the key is used for, or where they are in use (if I remember correctly, when you setup a Google Maps API key you must enter the domain names it will be valid for).

Is there one place in GCP to view everything that is used by a project so that I may determine if it is safe to delete it?

items.body_markdown: I have seen people using the HTTP code 500 as a generic error code for all kind of error cases (server errors, http errors, code exceptions, expected record not found in DB, time-out exceptions etc). However I have also read and heard that this code 500 should only be used in case of errors originating from the *application server* (JBoss in my case), and NOT *application* itself  i.e. not for code-exceptions or invalid passwords or DB-record-not-found cases. So, when should we return HTTP Status Code 500 from a REST service method?
items.title: When should I return HTTP Status Code 500 (Internal Server Error) from REST application to client?
items.body: I have seen people using the HTTP code 500 as a generic error code for all kind of error cases (server errors, http errors, code exceptions, expected record not found in DB, time-out exceptions etc). However I have also read and heard that this code 500 should only be used in case of errors originating from the application server (JBoss in my case), and NOT application itself i.e. not for code-exceptions or invalid passwords or DB-record-not-found cases. So, when should we return HTTP Status Code 500 from a REST service method?

items.title: Array of 420 json command line
items.body:
I was trying to figure out, why this canvas won't convert to json, using $_REQUEST[""].

This is what I tried so far:

body {
  background: #222;
  color: #558B2F
}
.mary {
  position: relative;
  height: 240px;
  width: 300px;
  margin: auto;
  animation: rotator 200s linear infinite;
}
.mary .leaf {
  position: absolute;
  bottom: 75px;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -95px;
  width: 150px;
  height: 150px;
  border-radius: 0 50% 0;
  background-color: #558B2F;
  background-size: 100% 100%, auto 10px;
  background-image: linear-gradient(to right top, #558B2F 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0) 50%), linear-gradient(to left, #689F38 50%, rgba(0, 0, 0, 0) 50%);
  background-clip: padding-box;
  border: 5px dotted #558B2F;
  transform-origin: 50% 100%;
  transform: rotate(90deg) scaleY(0.3) rotate(-45deg);
}
.mary .leaf.out {
  bottom: 55px;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -115px;
  width: 130px;
  height: 130px;
  transform: rotate(50deg) scaleY(0.3) rotate(-45deg);
}
.mary .leaf.out._2 {
  margin-left: -20px;
  transform: rotatex(180deg) rotate(230deg) scaleY(0.3) rotate(-45deg);
}
.mary .leaf.outer {
  bottom: 20px;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -75px;
  width: 80px;
  height: 80px;
  transform: rotate(10deg) scaleY(0.3)    rotate(-45deg);
}
.mary .leaf.outer._2 {
  margin-left: -5px;
  transform: rotatex(180deg) rotate(-170deg) scaleY(0.3) rotate(-45deg);
}
.mary .leaf.outest {
  bottom: 15px;
  left: 50%;
  margin-left: -25px;
  width: 30px;
  height: 30px;
  transform: rotate(-30deg) scaleY(0.3) rotate(-45deg);
}
.mary .leaf.outest._2 {
  margin-left: -10px;
  transform: rotatex(180deg) rotate(-210deg) scaleY(0.3) rotate(-45deg);
}

@keyframes rotator {
  from {
    transform: rotate(0deg);
  }
  to {
    transform: rotate(36000deg);
  }
}
<br><br>
<div class="mary">
  <div class="leaf center"></div>
  <div class="leaf out _1"></div>
  <div class="leaf out _2"></div>
  <div class="leaf outer _1"></div>
  <div class="leaf outer _2"></div>
  <div class="leaf outest _1"></div>
  <div class="leaf outest _2"></div>
</div>

import 'location.dart';

items.title: Method Mockito.when().thenReturn() and Mockito.doreturn().when() not returning specified mock value
items.body:
@InjectMocks
    private UserServiceImpl userService;

    @Mock
    private UserRepository  mockUserRepository;



    //private UserServiceImpl userServiceImpl;

    @Before
    public void initMocks() throws Exception {

        MockitoAnnotations.initMocks(this);
        mockUserRepository = Mockito.mock(UserRepository.class);
    }

    @Test
    public void testCreateUser() {

        User user = createUser();
        Mockito.doReturn(user).when(mockUserRepository).findByEmail(user.getEmail());       

        Mockito.when(mockUserRepository.save(user)).thenReturn(user);
        userService.createUser(user);
    }

private User createUser() {

        User user = new User();
        user.setFirstName("Shreya");
        user.setLastName("Mahajan");
        user.setEmail("shreya.mahajan@nitorinfotech.com");
        user.setRole("admin");
        user.setPassword("shreya123");

        return user;

    }

This is my actual service method. while testing it gives me null on variables existingUser and response

@Override
    public ResponseVO createUser(User user) {
        ResponseVO responseVO = new ResponseVO();
        User existingUser = userRepository.findByEmail(user.getEmail());
        if(user.getEmail() != null){
            if(existingUser != null){
                responseVO.setStatusCode("500");
                responseVO.setMessage("user Already Exists");
            }else{              
                User response = userRepository.save(user);
                if(response == null){
                    responseVO.setStatusCode("400");
                    responseVO.setMessage("Failure");                       
                }else{
                    responseVO.setStatusCode("200");
                    responseVO.setMessage("Success");       
                }
            }           
        }
        return responseVO;
    }

I am trying to write a test case and mock methods findByEmail() and save() but while mocking i am not receiving the user object in return mentioned in thenreturn() and doreturn().

Can anyone please help.

items.title: .htaccess auto_prepend_file only working for html files
items.body:
I have a .htaccess file here, and it seems that it's only adding the html files whenever I prepend. I have searched, changed, and done everything, I just can't get it! Here is what my .htaccess file looks like: 

<FilesMatch \.(?i:txt)$>
Order Allow,Deny
Deny from all 
</FilesMatch>

php_value date.timezone 'America/Los_Angeles'

AddType application/x-httpd-php .html .htm

php_value auto_prepend_file "/home/u684233983/public_html/includes/block.php" 
php_value auto_prepend_file "/home/u684233983/public_html/includes/particles.html" 
php_value auto_append_file "/home/u684233983/public_html/includes/particlesEnd.html" 

<Files VPN.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files>  
<Files CheckUser.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files> 
<Files CheckIP.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files> 
<Files Whitelist.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files> 
<Files Payment-Success.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files> 
<Files Admin.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files> 
<Files log.php>
php_value auto_prepend_file none 
php_value auto_append_file none 
</Files>

It's not adding the "blocked.php" (Yes, I checked. It's in that directory)

Any help appreciated!

items.body_markdown:
We are using few OSGi factory configurations in our authoring environment (AEM 6.2) like below -

Apache Sling Thread Pool Configuration
Apache Sling Job Queue Configuration

(these are factory configs) and, we have checked these in our source control system as below -

/apps/myProject/config.author/org.apache.sling.event.jobs.QueueConfiguration-abc.xml

/apps/myProject/config.author/org.apache.sling.event.jobs.QueueConfiguration-def.xml

What I am noticing that with each code deployment a set of duplicate OSGi configs start appearing from Felix console like below with different unique id but same name -

> org.apache.sling.event.jobs.QueueConfiguration.uniqueid1
> 
> org.apache.sling.event.jobs.QueueConfiguration.uniqueid2

Please suggest.
